channel.title: Sports
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Sports, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: 'I am Honored': Chelsea Turns to Liam Rosenior as New Manager
item.description: Liam Rosenior has been confirmed as the new manager of Chelsea.

item.title: Run It Back? Ole Gunnar Solskjaer Reportedly Eyes Manchester United Job
item.description: Ole Gunnar Solskjaer is reportedly open to the idea of returning to Manchester United as manager.

item.title: Coaching Carousel: Ranking the 6 NFL Head Coach Vacancies
item.description: Which NFL team has the most attractive head coach opening in the 2026 hiring cycle? Here's our breakdown.

item.title: North Carolina Coach Bill Belichick on Potential NFL Return: 'Nothing's Changed'
item.description: Bill Belichick confirmed his commitment to North Carolina amid six vacant NFL head-coaching positions.

item.title: Nick Wright on the Bills, Seahawks & Sam Darnold, Caleb Williams | FULL INTERVIEW | The Herd
item.description: Nick Wright joins Colin Cowherd to preview the Wild Card Weekend, including asking if the Buffalo Bills are Super Bowl or Bust, if Sam Darnold and the...

item.title: Nathan MacKinnon vs. Macklin Celebrini for MVP?
item.description: The latest poll from actual PHWA voters is in, with some big changes from December's edition.

item.title: AP Top 25 poll reaction: What to know about every team
item.description: The new women's AP Top 25 poll is out. Here's what's next for every team in the standings.

item.title: Bracketology: Gonzaga is doing Gonzaga things again
item.description: Outside of that one blowout loss, the Zags are unbeaten -- and could stay that way until Selection Sunday.

item.title: Bracketology: Kentucky is biggest winner as upsets shake up top 16
item.description: The new year has brought some big upsets, a shake-up of the top 16 seeds and a new-look Bracketology.

item.title: Inside Raiders' lost 2025 season: Tom Brady's influence, private meetings and dysfunction
item.description: "Who would want the Raiders job?" The inside story of how the Raiders went from playoff hopes to the No. 1 pick and another fired coach.
